verses.latin: Senior Gaio carissimo, quem ego diligo in veritate.
verses.english: The Elder writes this letter to Gaius, my dearest spiritual child, whom I love in the fullness of the Truth.

verses.latin: Carissime, de omnibus orationem facio prospere te agere, et valere sicut prospere agit anima tua.
verses.english: My dearest, I always pray for your complete well-being, that you may prosper in every aspect of your life and be in good health, just as your soul prospers in grace.

verses.latin: Gavisus sum valde venientibus fratribus, et testimonium perhibentibus veritati tuae, sicut et tu ambulas in veritate.
verses.english: I was overjoyed when our brothers in Christ came and bore witness to the fidelity of your life to the Truth, confirming that you indeed live according to the Truth of the Gospel.

verses.latin: Majorem horum non habeo gratiam, quam ut audiam filios meos in veritate ambulare.
verses.english: I have no greater spiritual joy than to hear that my spiritual children are living faithfully according to the Truth.

verses.latin: Carissime, fideliter facis quidquid operaris in fratres, et hoc in peregrinos,
verses.english: My dearest, you act with true fidelity in everything you do for our fellow Christians, and especially for those who are traveling missionaries.

verses.latin: qui testimonium reddiderunt caritati tuae in conspectu ecclesiæ: quos bene facies, deducens digne Deo.
verses.english: These very brothers have given public testimony to your selfless charity before the entire Church. You will do a good work to send them forth on their journey in a manner truly worthy of God's holy service.

verses.latin: Pro nomine enim ejus profecti sunt, nihil accipientes a gentibus.
verses.english: For they have gone forth on their mission for the sake of His holy Name, relying only on the faithful, accepting no material support from those who are not believers in Christ.

verses.latin: Nos ergo debemus suscipere hujusmodi, ut coadjutores simus veritatis.
verses.english: Therefore, we who believe ought to provide for and welcome such faithful missionaries, so that by our support, we may become their fellow laborers in the mission of the Truth.

verses.latin: Scripsi ecclesiæ: sed is qui amat primatum inter eos, Diotrephes, non recipit nos.
verses.english: I also wrote a letter to the Church there; however, Diotrephes, who loves to be the supreme authority among them, openly rejects our apostolic authority and guidance.

verses.latin: Propter hoc, si venero, commonebo ejus opera quæ facit, verbis malignis garriens in nos: et non contentus his, neque ipse recipit fratres: et eos qui volunt recipere prohibet, et de ecclesia ejicit.
verses.english: Because of this open defiance, if I come to visit, I will call attention to his wicked deeds: how he spreads malicious gossip against us with his words. And not content with merely doing this, he himself refuses to welcome the faithful traveling missionaries. Furthermore, he forbids those who desire to welcome them, and even casts them out of the Church community.

verses.latin: Carissime, noli imitari malum, sed quod bonum est. Qui benefacit, ex Deo est: qui malefacit, non vidit Deum.
verses.english: My dearest, do not imitate what is evil, but rather embrace what is truly good. He who consistently does good and acts righteously is a child of God. But he who consistently does evil and acts wrongly has not truly known God.

verses.latin: Demetrio testimonium redditum est ab omnibus, et ab ipsa veritate, sed et nos testimonium perhibemus: et scis quoniam testimonium nostrum verum est.
verses.english: Regarding Demetrius, everyone speaks well of him, and his very life itself gives testimony to the Truth. We also bear our own witness to him, and you know well that our testimony concerning him is undeniably true.

verses.latin: Multa habui scribere tibi: sed nolui per atramentum et calamum scribere tibi.
verses.english: I had many more things to communicate to you, but I chose not to commit them to writing with mere ink and pen.

verses.latin: Spero autem protinus te videre, et os ad os loqui. Pax tibi.
verses.english: Instead, I eagerly hope to see you very soon, so that we may speak to one another face to face. May peace be with you always.

verses.latin: Salutant te amici. Saluta amicos per nomen.
verses.english: All the faithful here send their greetings to you. Please, in turn, greet all our beloved friends in the faith there, personally by name.
